prompt: <description>**Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Curved Top and a Flat Bottom** 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0206, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. 3. On the sketch, create a rectangle by drawing 4 lines: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0702], End Point [0.0, 0.413] * Line 2: Start Point [0.0, 0.413], End Point [0.0129, 0.413] * Line 3: Start Point [0.0129, 0.413], End Point [0.0129, 0.5254] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0129, 0.5254], End Point [0.0, 0.5254] 4. Draw 10 more lines to create a pattern of vertical lines along the length of the rectangle: * Line 5: Start Point [0.0, 0.5254], End Point [0.1217, 0.5254] * Line 6: Start Point [0.1217, 0.5254], End Point [0.0914, 0.1712] * Line 7: Start Point [0.0914, 0.1712], End Point [0.0785, 0.1719] * Line 8: Start Point [0.0785, 0.1719], End Point [0.0741, 0.0889] * Line 9: Start Point [0.0741, 0.0889], End Point [0.0612, 0.0889] * Line 10: Start Point [0.0612, 0.0889], End Point [0.0612, 0.0] * Line 11: Start Point [0.0612, 0.0], End Point [0.0129, 0.0] * Line 12: Start Point [0.0129, 0.0], End Point [0.0129, 0.0702] * Line 13: Start Point [0.0129, 0.0702], End Point [0.0, 0.0702] 5. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 7. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.0206 units to create a 3D model. This will result in a rectangular prism with a curved top and a flat bottom. The top and bottom edges of the prism are straight, and there are a series of vertical lines along its length. The model is centered on a white background. **Part 1 Dimensions:** - Height: 0.75 - Width: 0.0206 - Length (along the Z-axis after extrusion): 0.75</description>

Part 2 Instructions Shape: Two cylindrical objects with a rectangular shape in between, positioned parallel to each other Coordinate System 1. It is centered and occupies a significant portion of the image. * Height: 0.1612 * Width: 0.75 * Length: 0.1612</description>

<description>Part 1: Creating the Base of the Model The model begins with a 2D sketch of a rectangular shape on a plane defined by the coordinate system. The shape is constructed as follows: 1. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles (0°, 0°, -90°) and translation vector (0, 0.5, 0). 2. Create face_1 of the sketch. 3. Starting from point (0, 0), create line_1 and extend it to point (0.75, 0). 4. Starting from point (0.75, 0), create line_2 and extend it to point (0.75, 0.25). 5. Starting from point (0.75, 0.25), create line_3 and extend it to point (0, 0.25). 6. Starting from point (0, 0.25), create line_4 and extend it to point (0, 0). These lines form a closed loop. Now, we will proceed to transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by extruding it. The 3D sketch has the following properties: 1. Extrusion depth towards the normal is set to 0.5 units. 2. Extrusion depth opposite normal is set to 0 units. 3. Sketch scale is set to 0.75 units. 4. The operation is defined as NewBodyFeatureOperation, which creates a new solid body. Part 2: Adding a Tapered Top to the Model Now that the base is created, we will add a slightly tapered top to the model. The process is similar to creating the base, except for the addition of a second face to the sketch: 1. Preserve the existing coordinate system: euler angles (0°, 0°, -90°) and translation vector (0, 0.5, 0). 2. Create a second face of the sketch (face_2). 3. Starting from point (0, 0.25), create line_1 and extend it to point (0.75, 0.25). 4. Starting from point (0.75, 0.25), create line_2 and extend it to point (0.75, 0.625). 5. Starting from point (0.75, 0.625), create line_3 and extend it to point (0.5, 0.625). 6. Continue with line_4, and extend it from point (0.5, 0.625) to point (0.5, 0.5273). 7. Create line_5 from point (0.5, 0.5273) to point (0.25, 0.5273). 8. Extend line_6 from point (0.25, 0.5273) to point (0.25, 0.625). 9. Complete the loop by extending line_7 from point (0.25, 0.625) to point (0, 0.625). 10. Finally, create line_8 from point (0, 0.625) to point (0, 0.25) to close the loop. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using similar parameters as the base extrusion, but set the operation to JoinFeatureOperation, which will add the tapered section to the previously constructed part. By following these instructions, you will obtain the final shape, which is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, where the sides are parallel, meeting at right angles, and with dimensions 2 units by 3 units by 4 units.</description>
